question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: create_supra_oracle_provider_config()] [Pair ID Conversion] Does adaptor_supra::pair_id_to_vector() properly convert u32 pair_id to vector<u8>, or can overflow/truncation cause wrong Supra feeds to be referenced? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: create_supra_oracle_provider_config()] [Duplicate Supra] Can both Pyth and Supra configs be created for the same feed_id, and if so, which takes precedence if both are enabled as primary? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_pyth_price_oracle_provider_pair_id()] [Pair ID Switch] Can pair_id be changed while the provider is actively serving as primary, causing price lookups to fail or return wrong asset prices mid-operation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_supra_price_source_pair_id()] [Invalid Vector] Can set_supra_price_source_pair_id() be called with a pair_id vector that's empty or has wrong length, bypassing the u32 conversion and causing Supra lookups to fail? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: enable_pyth_oracle_provider()] [No Config Check] Can enable_pyth_oracle_provider() be called before create_pyth_oracle_provider_config(), causing config::set_oracle_provider_config_enable() to fail or create inconsistent state? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: disable_pyth_oracle_provider()] [Primary Disable] Can disable_pyth_oracle_provider() successfully disable a provider that's currently set as primary, breaking price feed functionality without proper fallback? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: disable_supra_oracle_provider()] [Disable All] Can an attacker disable both Pyth and Supra providers leaving no valid price sources, causing permanent DoS for that feed? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: enable_pyth_oracle_provider()] [Race Condition] Can enable/disable be called in rapid succession causing state inconsistencies where oracle_provider_configs.enable doesn't match the actual usage? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: enable_supra_oracle_provider()] [Invalid Enable] Can a provider be enabled even if its pair_id is invalid or the external oracle contract doesn't exist, causing runtime failures? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_primary_oracle_provider()] [Disabled Provider] Can set_primary_oracle_provider() set a disabled provider as primary, bypassing the enable check in config::set_primary_oracle_provider()? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_primary_oracle_provider()] [Nonexistent Config] Can set_primary_oracle_provider() be called with a provider that has no config created, causing table lookup failures? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_secondary_oracle_provider()] [Empty Provider] Can set_secondary_oracle_provider() set an empty provider (oracle_provider::new_empty_provider()) as secondary, and does this properly indicate no fallback is available? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_secondary_oracle_provider()] [Same Provider] Can primary and secondary be set to the same provider, defeating the purpose of having a fallback and creating circular dependency? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_primary_oracle_provider()] [Provider Switch] Can primary provider be switched while price fetches are in progress, causing inconsistent reads where some operations use old provider and others use new? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_secondary_oracle_provider()] [No Enable Check] Does config::set_secondary_oracle_provider() skip enable checks if provider is not empty, allowing a disabled secondary to be set? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_primary_oracle_provider()] [Early Return] Does the early return 'if (price_feed.primary == provider) return' in config allow re-setting the same primary without validation, potentially skipping important checks? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_enable_to_price_feed()] [Invalid Feed ID] Can feed_id parameter be a non-existent address causing config::set_enable_to_price_feed() to abort, or can it reference an object that's not actually a price feed? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [All Setter Functions] [Feed Existence] Do all functions that take feed_id parameter properly validate that table::contains(&cfg.feeds, feed_id) before operations, or can some bypass this check? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_max_timestamp_diff_to_price_feed()] [Wrong Feed] Can feed_id point to a price feed for a different coin type than intended, causing configuration to be applied to the wrong asset? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: create_price_feed()] [Feed ID Collision] Can the generated feed_id (object::uid_to_address(&uid)) collide with an existing feed_id if object IDs are predictable or manipulated? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_price_diff_threshold1_to_price_feed()] [Atomic Update] Can threshold1 and threshold2 be updated in separate transactions, creating a window where threshold1 > threshold2 violating invariants? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_maximum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Bound Race] Can maximum and minimum prices be updated non-atomically, creating a window where maximum < minimum causing all prices to be rejected? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: version_migrate()] [Concurrent Migration] Can version_migrate() be called multiple times concurrently on the same oracle_config, causing version to be set inconsistently? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_pause()] [Pause Race] Can set_pause() and price update operations race, causing some operations to see paused state while others don't, leading to inconsistent oracle behavior? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: create_price_feed()] [Concurrent Creation] Can multiple create_price_feed() calls be executed concurrently for different CoinTypes, and does config::is_price_feed_exists() properly prevent race conditions? (Low)
